tasks.task: Drive a tractor through a field
subtasks: Sit in the driver's seat
Operate the steering wheel to navigate the tractor through the field
Engage the tractor's transmission to move forward
Adjust the speed of the tractor using the throttle
Monitor the direction and path while driving
Avoid obstacles or uneven terrain while moving
Approach the baling area with the tractor and baler attached
Position the baler correctly to pick up hay
Start the baler's engine
Engage the baler's clutch or transmission to begin operation
Adjust the height of the pickup teeth to pick up the desired amount of hay
Operate the baler's hydraulic system to compress the hay into bales
Monitor the bale size and density to ensure quality
Unload the bales when full and deposit them in the desired location
Park the truck near the bales to be loaded
Deploy a bale fork or similar device onto the truck
Lift the fork and extend it towards the hay bales
Position the fork under a bale, engage the grip mechanism
Lift the bale onto the truck bed
Repeat steps for additional bales as needed
Secure the bales on the truck to prevent movement during transport
Position the truck near the storage area
Lower the tailgate or ramps to unload
Remove the bales from the truck one by one
If using a forklift, operate it to lift and place bales into storage
Place bales by hand onto pallets or shelves for stacking
Stack the bales neatly and secure them to prevent collapse
Select the appropriate fertilizer applicator attached to the tractor
Calibration of the applicator for correct fertilizer rates
Drive the tractor through the field, applying the fertilizer evenly
Monitor the spreader operation to ensure proper distribution
Refill the applicator as needed during the job

tasks.task: Operate a sprayer to apply pesticide
subtasks: Attach the pesticide spray tank to the tractor
Fill the tank with the specified pesticide
Set the spray pressure and flow rate
Drive the tractor through the target area, applying the pesticide uniformly
Monitor the boom or nozzle to ensure proper coverage
Follow any safety protocols when using chemicals

tasks.task: Harvest crops with a combine harvester
subtasks: Pair the combine harvester with a tractor
Position the harvester in the field to begin harvesting
Start the combine's engine and adjust the settings
Engage the combine's conveyors and threshing mechanism
Monitor the crop flow through the machine
Ensure proper cleaning of the header and stems
Collect the harvested grain into containers or bags
Remove impurities and unwanted materials from the grain

tasks.task: Plant seeds with a seeding machine
subtasks: Set up the seeding machine on the tractor
Calibration of the machine for correct seed spacing and depth
Drive the tractor through the field, planting seeds as per the plan
Monitor the seeder's tooth adjustment and depth mechanisms
Check the seed count and ensure proper germination rates
Identify the malfunctioning equipment and determine the problem
Gather the necessary tools and replacement parts
Disassemble the equipment to access the faulty component
Replace or repair the problematic part
Reassemble the equipment and perform a test run

tasks.task: Milk cows in a dairy farm
subtasks: Approach a cow in a milking parlor
Clean the cow's udder with disinfectant
Attach the milking machine cups to the teats
Start the milking process, monitor for any issues
After milking, verify the milk quality and discard any abnormal samples
Detach the cups and clean the udder again
Document production data for each cow
Move to the next cow in the parlor

tasks.task: Feed animals in a livestock farm
subtasks: Assemble feed troughs or hay racks
Measure and distribute the appropriate amount of feed
Distribute fresh water to the animals
Observe the animals for any signs of illness or distress
Clean feeding areas and remove uneaten food to prevent spoilage

tasks.task: Gather eggs in a poultry farm
subtasks: Walk through the coop or barn where the chickens are housed
Collect eggs from the nesting boxes
Sort and clean the collected eggs if necessary
Place the sorted eggs into storage containers
WALK THROUGH THE FIELD TO LOCATE WEEDS
GRasp a weed with hand
Uproot the weed by pulling or using a tool
PLACE WEED IN A BUCKET OR BAG FOR DISPOSAL
CHECK THE Surrounding Areas to ensure all weeds are removed
Connect the irrigation system to a water source
Adjust the nozzle or sprinkler heads to cover the intended area
Operate the irrigation valves or timer to start the water flow
Monitor water distribution and check for leaks or malfunctions
Identify branches requiring pruning
Use pruning shears or a saw to cut branches at the appropriate joints
Dispose of pruned branches properly
Ensure no damage is done to healthy parts of the tree
CLimb a ladder to reach the upper branches
GRasp an apple and gently twist or lift it to remove from the stem
Place harvested apples into a basket or container
Check for ripe apples and avoid bruising others
Descend from the ladder safely
Wash and sort apples to remove any blemished or damaged fruit
CORE and peel the selected apples
Grind the apples into a pulp
Press the pulp to extract juice
Strain the juice to remove solids
Pasteurize and bottle the cider
ATTACH a distributor to a tractor
Adjust fertilizer quantities and distribution pattern
Drive the tractor over the pasture areas to disperse the fertilizer
Monitor the spreader to ensure even distribution

tasks.task: Perform milking duties on a dairy farm
subtasks: CLEAN cow stalls and bedding areas
ATTACH harnesses to cows for milking
Move cows into the milking parlor
CALF a milking schedule for the day
ASSIST in the milking process when needed
Perform minor dairy tasks such as checking on new calf births
Identify the livestock to be vaccinated
Prepare the vaccination by mixing or administering the dose
Approach the animal and hold it securely
Inject the vaccine into the correct location
OBSERVE the animal for any adverse reactions

tasks.task: Check the integrity of farm fences
subtasks: Inspect the perimeter fence for any gaps or damage
CHECK the condition of fence posts and rails
TIGHTEN or replace straps and fastenings as necessary
Ensure gates are functioning properly
Inspect troughs, tanks, or automatic waterers
Check for leaks or clogs in the system
Refill water sources as needed
Clean water bowls or reservoirs to prevent bacterial growth
Prepare the seed by checking quality and sorting
Load the seed into the seeder's hopper
Couple the seeder to the tractor
Adjust furrow depth and spacing as per the crop requirements
Drive the seeder through the field, ensuring proper seeding rate
SETUP a spreader or wagon to hold the manure
MIX or pile the manure to ensure even application
Drive the equipment over the fields, spreading the manure at the desired rate
Monitor the spreader to prevent overapplying or underapplying

tasks.task: Operate an excavation tool on a tractor
subtasks: CLARỂ the type of excavation tool being used (e.g., backhoe, scraper)
ATTACH the appropriate tool to the tractor's hydraulic system
OPERATE the tool to dig or move soil as needed
Maneuver the tool with precision around obstacles
Fill or relocate excavated material as required
ATTACH a baler or windrow mower to the tractor
Prep the field to create windrows if necessary
DRIVE the equipment over the residue, creating windrows
BALE the residue as needed and transport to storage
LOAD grain into the dryer
START the drying process and adjust temperature and airflow
MONITOR the grain temperature to prevent overheating
CHECK for any signs of dampness or mold growth
USE a soil probe or auger to take samples from different areas
Store the samples properly for laboratory analysis

tasks.task: Mount and dismount a combine harvester
subtasks: Attach the combine to a trailer for transport
Shake the harvester to remove any residual grain
Remove the combine's hood or access panels as needed
CLimb onto the combine's platform to check and service components
REALEASE any attachments to equipment such as corn heads
ATTACH other implements like plows or disc harrows
PREPARE the land for the next planting season by cultivating or tilling

tasks.task: Clean and maintain a potato harvester
subtasks: Dismount the harvester from the tractor
Disassemble the machine to access internal components
Clean parts to remove dirt and debris
Lubricate moving parts according to maintenance schedule
REINSTALL components and test the harvester's operation
Place potatoes into a basket or tray for peeling
GRASP a potato and place it on a peeler or scraper
USE the tool to remove the skin, ensuring not to damage the flesh
STACK peeled potatoes and discard peels

tasks.task: Apply a protective fungicide to crops at harvest
subtasks: Select the fungicide applicator and attach it to the tractor
Drive through the fields just after harvest to喷洒 fungicide
Monitor the application to ensure even coverage
Keep safety gear, such as gloves and respirators, on hand
Mow grass or legumes to lay down as hay
Allow the cut vegetation to dry until it reaches optimal moisture content for baling
Use a baler to wrap the dried hay into bales
Transport the baled hay to storage or sale area
START the pivots moving around the field
Monitor the spray pattern and ensure coverage
Adjust the height or angle of the pivot arm as needed
Check for any leaks or breaks in the system
Mon polygons of the wearing condition of the livestock
EXAMINE animals for signs of illness or injury
Administer medications or treatments as needed
Supervise feeding and milking schedules
Keep detailed records of health, production, and reproduction data
Select the appropriate pesticide for the specific weed problem
Calibrate the sprayer to apply the correct concentration
Spray the designated areas, being careful not to overapply
ATTACH the plow to the tractor
Ajust the plowshares to the desired depth
Drive the plow through the field to break up the soil
Ensure even penetration and avoid unnecessary compaction
HARVEST the crop that will be made into silage
CHOP the crops into the desired length
PACK the material into a silo or pile, ensuring it is tightly compacted
Seal the silo to prevent spoilage
ATTACH a lime distributor to the tractor
Adjust the spreading rate based on soil test results
DRIVES over the field, evenly distributing the lime
CHECK for any skipped areas or overapplication

tasks.task: Monitor and adjust a rotary cutter
subtasks: Gather the necessary tools to check the cutter's condition
Inspect the cutting blades for dullness or damage
Sharpen or replace blades as needed
Ajust the gap between the cutter bars for optimal cutting height
Determine the best method (e.g., grinding or excavating)
OPERATE a stump grinder or excavator to remove the stump
Backfill the area where the stump was removed
Grade the soil to ensure level ground
Select the appropriate fertilizer banding equipment
Position the equipment near the crop rows
Drive through the field, applying fertilizer in bands alongside the crops
Monitor side dressing operations to ensure correct depth and spacing
attaching seed boxes to the planter
Adjust planting depths and seed spacings
Drive the planter through the prepared soil, planting seeds as per the plan
Check the seeder’s down pressure system for proper seed-to-soil contact
DETERMINE the correct material (e.g., herbicide) to control regrowth
Calibrate the sprayer properly for the application rate
SPRAYER the areas that need suppression
Follow up after application to check if the retardant has taken effect
Inspect the tractor for any visible damage or wear
CHECK fluid levels (oil, coolant, hydraulic fluid)
LUBRICATE moving parts as needed
